Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with part of handle zone; white slip; interior: glazed black with two added white bands; exterior, from top: part of tongue pattern beside handle root (now lost); broken maeander band between bands; rays above dilute lines at base; two drip splashes on lower body.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 49 note 100, p. 234, no. 136)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0124) (phase 2)
